pageContext.description: Thin single-edged blade, with slight curve: the cutting edge is broken at each end of the fragt., but preserved in the middle. Slightly bent. At the wider end is a projection (circular) about 5 mm high. There is no corresponding projection on the other side.
pageContext.patina: Greeny brown patina, with traces of golden bronze on the faces and along the back of the blade.
pageContext.surface: Smooth generally; slightly pitted on side remote from the projection.
pageContext.collection: c/o A. Peachey,151 Bingham Road, Addiscombe, Nr. Croydon,April 1926
pageContext.remarks: Perhaps a sickle. At first sight, it resembles part of the rim of a cauldron, owing to the bend, but this bend is due to distortion.
